title: Nine, Seven, Ten, Foxtel and SBS partner on ad platform
text:
Nine, Seven West Media, Network Ten, Foxtel and SBS have put traditional rivalries aside to develop a new joint platform which will allow media agencies to buy advertising across commercial television in one place.

The five companies have committed to building a demand-side trading platform for big media groups and independent agencies. They have commenced due diligence to scope out a technical supplier with the expectation it will be ready for use by April 2021.

Old rivals are banding together for the good of the industry. Phil Carrick

The platform would allow media agencies to buy linear television, live and on-demand streaming against different audience segments and demographics, measure a campaign's reach and analyse it in real time.

Nine chief sales officer Michael Stephenson said the introduction of Virtual Oz, a new integrated database combining linear TV with live streaming and catch-up on all devices which will be available early 2020, was the starting point.

"For agencies to be able to buy those audiences, it’s really important they have a leading piece of ad tech," he said.
description: The five companies have put traditional rivalries to the side, banding together to develop a new platform where media agencies can buy advertising across commercial television in one place.
